item.title: New Agar Grove Bridge junction between Agar Grove, Murray street and St Augustine's Roads, 23rd September
item.description:
Dear Council, This is the 4th message I have had to leave here to ask for an update on the issue with the street lights around the area of the new Agar Grove bridge. The council keeps dismissing my concerns about the lack of working street lights in our area following the completion of the new bridge works by BAM after about 3 months now. We need to know what the plan is to re-instate proper street lights in our neighbourhood. The street lights are still not working and this is now a hazard as the days are growing shorter and feels dangerous to walk back home in the dark after work. The metal fences left over by BAM with lights affixed on them as a temporary measure are not a solution! BAM has let us know that the delay is because of the council not installing the street light arms and lanterns. I can currently see that these are indeed still not installed yet. Please let us know specifically by when will you take action on this so that we can have proper street lights again and the metal fences left by BAM removed. Please provide us with a timeframe and brief plan. A 3 month delay on this is excessive and with days growing smaller the lack of proper street lights is potentially hazardous as you understand. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Augustine's Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In front of 149 Granville Road NW6 and along Granville Road, 23rd September
item.description:
Litter needs Sweeping. NO SIGN of Estate Cleaners or Street Cleaners on Granville Road NW6. If you Report the street needs Sweeping it does NOT go down very well. The Estate Cleaners are NOT Sweeping in front of Residents homes on Granville Road. A Few are Elderly and Cannot do it. I do the Sweeping of leaves, litter, Rubbish etc in front of My beloved Elderly Mum’s home and my Elderly Neighbor Les home as it is NOT DONE ANYMORE. It’s DISGRACEFUL. These people are being PAID to do a job and it’s NOT being done. Cleaner Streets is Brent’s Moto. This side of Brent the Estate and Street Cleaners are seen very Rarely. The Estate Cleaners are doing only inside the Blocks NOT OUTSIDE. Why should I have to do it? They are being PAID

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner shop covered in graffiti, 23rd September
item.description:
Please can we get all this clean up? As part of the 'graffiti blitz' in Peckham at the moment. All the walls, windows and rolling shutters are covered in graffiti. thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London

item.title: Offensive sticker with swearing on sign, 23rd September
item.description:
Near to bins and pedestrian crossing Belgrave Road. The sticker says 'merda' which is a swear word in Spanish. The area has many Spanish-speaking locals and tourists who will be offended to see this on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wall is filthy and covered in graffiti, 23rd September
item.description:
Please clean up this wall of Dunstall House, next to the bus stop. It's really in an unacceptable condition, filthy, gross and covered in graffiti. please wash it all of, especially the graffiti. If you allow it to stay there it sends the wrong message to the criminals that they can get away with this ASB. Thank you. Peckham High St.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 149, Peckham High Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed collection on Cricketers Walk, 23rd September
item.description:
My bin hasn't been emptied on the scheduled collection date, but all the other bins in the bin shed appear to have been. This is the 4th or 5th time in the last year this has happened. The bin is completely full and there is no collection due again until 7 October.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cricketers Walk, Perry Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet
